name: IISWebAppManagement
description: Create or update the Website and App Pool on an IIS using machine group
author: Microsoft Corporation
helpMarkDown: Replace with markdown to show in help

inputs.name: CreateWebsite
inputs.label: Create or Update Website
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create a website or to update an existing website.

inputs.name: WebsiteName
inputs.label: Website Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide the name of the IIS website. It will be created if new, or else the existing website will be updated.
For deploying a Web project to the website, use the same name as specified in the Web deploy zip package file. If in the Web App deployment task, a Parameter file and Override Parameter settings are also specified, then the website name that the app will be deployed to be, is the one specified in the Override Parameters setting.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPath
inputs.label: Physical Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the physical path where the website content will be stored. The content can reside on the local Computer, or in a remote directory, or on a network share, like C:\Fabrikam or \\\\ContentShare\Fabrikam.

inputs.name: WebsitePhysicalPathAuth
inputs.label: Physical Path Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the authentication mechanism that will be used to access the physical path of the website.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserName
inputs.label: User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name that will be used to access the website's physical path.

inputs.name: WebsiteAuthUserPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user's password that will be used to access the website's physical path. If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AddBinding
inputs.label: Add Binding
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to add port binding for the website.

inputs.name: Protocol
inputs.label: Protocol
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select HTTP for the website to have an HTTP binding, or select HTTPS for the website to have a Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) binding.

inputs.name: IPAddress
inputs.label: IP Address
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Provide an IP address that end-users can use to access this website.
If 'All Unassigned' is selected, then the website will respond to requests for all IP addresses on the port and for the host name, unless another website on the server has a binding on the same port but with a specific IP address.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.label: Port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the port, where the Hypertext Transfer Protocol Stack (HTTP.sys) will listen to the website requests.

inputs.name: ServerNameIndication
inputs.label: Server Name Indication Required
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the option to set the Server Name Indication (SNI) for the website.
SNI extends the SSL and TLS protocols to indicate the host name that the clients are attempting to connect to. It allows, multiple secure websites with different certificates, to use the same IP address.

inputs.name: HostNameWithOutSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithHttp
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: HostNameWithSNI
inputs.label: Host Name
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter a host name (or domain name) for the website.
If a host name is specified, then the clients must use the host name instead of the IP address to access the website.

inputs.name: SSLCertThumbPrint
inputs.label: SSL Certificate Thumb Print
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the thumb-print of the Secure Socket Layer certificate that the website is going to use for the HTTPS communication as a 40 character long hexadecimal string. The SSL certificate should be already installed on the Computer, at Local Computer, Personal store.

inputs.name: CreateAppPool
inputs.label: Create or Update Application Pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to create an application pool or to update an existing application pool.

inputs.name: AppPoolName
inputs.label: Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the name of the IIS application pool. Either a new app pool will be created if it doesn't exist, or the existing app pool will be updated with the settings specified here.

inputs.name: DotNetVersion
inputs.label: .NET Version
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select the version of the .NET Framework that is loaded by the application pool.
If the applications assigned to this application pool do not contain managed code, then select the 'No Managed Code' option from the list.

inputs.name: PipeLineMode
inputs.label: Managed Pipeline Mode
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the managed pipeline mode that specifies how IIS processes requests for managed content. Use classic mode only when the applications in the application pool cannot run in the Integrated mode.

inputs.name: AppPoolIdentity
inputs.label: Identity
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the account under which an application pool's worker process runs. Select one of the predefined security accounts or configure a custom account.

inputs.name: AppPoolPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using a gMSA, this is not required.

inputs.name: AppCmdCommands
inputs.label: Additional AppCmd.exe Commands
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter additional AppCmd.exe commands to set the website or the application pool properties. For more than one command use a line separator, like
list apppools
list sites
recycle apppool /apppool.name:ExampleAppPoolName

inputs.name: DeployInParallel
inputs.label: Deploy in Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the option to deploy the website in-parallel on the target machines.
